morequesttypes.reward.complete_object.ta: Quest or task IDs to complete. Use # for tags (e.g., #sometag) or hex IDs for specific quests/tasks.
morequesttypes.reward.reset_object.targe: Quest or task IDs to reset. Use # for tags (e.g., #sometag) or hex IDs for specific quests/tasks.

Volume of the sound (0.0 to 10.0). 1.0 is normal volume.

morequesttypes.reward.summon.random_spaw: Random offset radius in blocks. 0 = exact position.

morequesttypes.reward.summon.use_absolut: If true, uses absolute world coordinates. If false, uses relative to player position.
morequesttypes.reward.summon.spawn_x.too: X coordinate offset (relative) or absolute position.

morequesttypes.reward.summon.spawn_z.too: Z coordinate offset (relative) or absolute position.
morequesttypes.reward.summon.duration_ti: How long the entity exists before despawning. -1 = permanent (respects other despawn conditions).
morequesttypes.reward.summon.spawn_limit: Maximum number of entities from this reward that can exist per player. -1 = unlimited.
morequesttypes.reward.summon.despawn_dis: Distance in blocks. Entity despawns if player moves farther away.
morequesttypes.reward.summon.despawn_if_: If true, entity despawns when the player logs off.
If true, entity despawns when the player dies.
If true, entity won't despawn naturally (still respects other despawn conditions).

morequesttypes.reward.summon.follow.tool: If true, entity follows the player.
morequesttypes.reward.summon.aggro.toolt: Who the entity should attack: NONE, CLOSEST, FARTHEST, or CLAIMER (quest completer).

Chestplate item to equip on the entity.

morequesttypes.reward.summon.offhand.too: Item to equip in the entity's off hand.

Y offset for the custom texture position.

morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.title: %s to %s
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.operation: ADD: Adds entries to a list or compound. REMOVE: Removes entries from a list. SET: Replaces the entire value.
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.path.tool:
The path to the NBT tag. Use dots (.) to navigate nested tags. Prefix with 'root.' to access item-level fields.

Examples:
• minecraft:custom_name - Component custom name
• more_quest_types:equipment_bonuses.bonuses - Attribute bonuses list
• root.id - Item type (e.g., minecraft:diamond_sword)
• root.count - Item stack size
• spell_engine:spell_container.spell_ids - Spell list
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.check_exi: Only apply the operation if this path already exists in the item's NBT.
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.nbt_entri:
List of SNBT entries to add/remove/set. Each entry is automatically quoted as a string.

Value Examples:
• minecraft:diamond_sword (for root.id)
• 64 (for root.count)
• '"Custom Name"' (for custom_name - note the quotes)

List/Compound Examples:
• {amount:5.0d,attribute:"minecraft:generic.armor",modifier_id:"custom_armor",operation:"ADD_VALUE",slot:"chest"}
• {id:"minecraft:protection",lvl:4s}

Placeholders (team rewards only):
• {claimer_name} - Player's name
• {claimer_uuid} - Player's UUID
• {claimer_uuid_array} - UUID as int array
Controls operation behavior:

TRUE (Value Mode):
• ADD: Adds to numeric value (e.g., health += 5)
• REMOVE: Subtracts from numeric value (e.g., durability -= 10)
• SET: Replaces with new value (e.g., count = 64)
• Works on: Single values like count, id, custom_name

FALSE (List/Compound Mode):
• ADD: Appends to list or merges into compound
• REMOVE: Removes matching entries from list
• SET: Replaces entire list/compound
• Works on: Lists like bonuses, spell_ids, enchantments
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.target_sl: Which equipment slot to modify: MAINHAND, OFFHAND, HEAD, CHEST, LEGS, or FEET.
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.target_it: Only modify items matching this type. Leave empty to modify any item in the target slot.
morequesttypes.reward.nbt_path.condition:
Condition that must be met for the operation to apply:

NONE: Always apply
PATH_EXISTS: Path must exist
PATH_NOT_EXISTS: Path must not exist
ENTRY_EXISTS: Check if specific entry exists in list/compound
ENTRY_NOT_EXISTS: Check if specific entry doesn't exist
VALUE_EQUALS: Value must match exactly
VALUE_NOT_EQUALS: Value must not match
VALUE_COMPARE: Use comparison mode (>, <, ==, etc.)

NBT path to check for the condition. Supports 'root.' prefix for item-level fields.

Examples:
• root.id - Check item type
• minecraft:custom_name - Check custom name
• more_quest_types:equipment_bonuses.bonuses - Check attribute list

Values to check against when using ENTRY_EXISTS, ENTRY_NOT_EXISTS, VALUE_EQUALS, or VALUE_NOT_EQUALS conditions.

Examples:
• minecraft:zombie_spawn_egg (check if item ID matches)
• {attribute:"minecraft:generic.armor"} (check if armor bonus exists)
• '"Custom Name"' (check if custom name matches)

Supports placeholders: {claimer_name}, {claimer_uuid}, {claimer_uuid_array}
How many condition entries must match. -1 = all entries must match. Set to 1 to require at least one match, 2 for at least two, etc.
morequesttypes.reward.equipment_attribut: Unique identifier for this modifier. Leave empty to use the item's ID as default.
The entity attribute to modify (e.g., minecraft:generic.attack_damage).
The value to modify the attribute by. Can be negative.
ADD_VALUE: Flat addition. ADD_MULTIPLIED_BASE: % of base value. ADD_MULTIPLIED_TOTAL: % of total value.
Which equipment slot to modify (MAIN_HAND, OFF_HAND, HEAD, CHEST, LEGS, FEET).

ADD: Add new modifier. REMOVE: Remove existing modifier. SET: Replace existing modifier. ADD_TO: Add to existing value. SUBTRACT_FROM: Subtract from existing value. REPLACE_WITH: Replace attribute ID and/or value.
Only apply if this attribute already exists on the item. Leave empty to skip condition check.
How to compare the existing attribute value against the condition values.
The value to compare against, or minimum value for range comparisons.
Maximum value for range comparisons. Ignored for non-range comparisons.
When using REPLACE_WITH mode, the new attribute ID. Leave empty to keep the same attribute.
If enabled, replaces the attribute value with the specified value below.
When Use Replace Value is enabled, the new value to set.
Only apply if the target attribute already exists on the item.
If enabled and condition attribute doesn't exist, uses the middle value between first and second for comparison. If disabled, missing attribute defaults to 0.
morequesttypes.task.place_block.block.to: The block type that must be placed. Leave empty for any block.
morequesttypes.task.place_block.block_ta: Match blocks in this tag instead of a specific block type.
morequesttypes.task.place_block.title: Place %s × %s
